p:
Enzyme replacement therapy with recombinant human IDS (idursulfase, Elaprase, and idursulfase beta, Hunterase) has been used to treat MPS II and is known to improve the aforementioned somatic symptoms. 5, 6, 7, 8 However, intravenously administrated idursulfase cannot cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB) in sufficient quantity to address the neurocognitive disorders caused by MPS II, which remain a debilitating issue for patients and are therefore a major focus of lysosomal disorder research.
3
